{{cpp/title|common_type&lt;small&gt;&lt;''tuple-like''&gt;&lt;/small&gt;}}
{{cpp/utility/tuple/navbar}}
{{ddcl|header=tuple|since=c++23|
template&lt; tuple-like TTuple, tuple-like UTuple &gt;
    requires /* see below */
struct common_type&lt;TTuple, UTuple&gt;;
}}

The common type of two {{rlpi|tuple-like}} types is a {{lc|std::tuple}} consists of the common types of all corresponding element type pairs of both types.

Given
* {{tt|TTypes}} as the pack formed by the sequence of {{c/core|std::tuple_element_t&lt;i, TTuple&gt;}} for every integer {{c|i}} in {{range|​0|std::tuple_size_v&lt;TTuple&gt;}}, and
* {{tt|UTypes}} as the pack formed by the sequence of {{c/core|std::tuple_element_t&lt;i, UTuple&gt;}} for every integer {{c|i}} in {{range|​0|std::tuple_size_v&lt;UTuple&gt;}},
the following constraints need to be satisfied:
* {{tt|TTuple}} or {{tt|UTuple}} is a {{lc|std::tuple}} specialization.
* {{c|std::is_same_v&lt;TTuple, std::decay_t&lt;TTuple&gt;&gt;}} is {{c|true}}.
* {{c|std::is_same_v&lt;UTuple, std::decay_t&lt;UTuple&gt;&gt;}} is {{c|true}}.
* {{c|std::tuple_size_v&lt;TTuple&gt;}} equals {{c|std::tuple_size_v&lt;UTuple&gt;}} ({{tt|TTuple}} and {{tt|UTuple}} have the same number of elements).
* {{c/core|std::tuple&lt;std::common_type_t&lt;TTypes, UTypes&gt;...&gt;}} denotes a type.
